The below code will create a bubble chart of a car's horsepower(x), miles per gallon (y), and weight (bubble size). The data are from: https://www.kaggle.com/unsdsn/world-happiness

```{r chart}

# Set working directory
setwd("C:/Users/AndrewB/Downloads/world-happiness-report")

# Load data
happiness2015 <- read.csv("2015.csv")

# Install and load ggplot2
install.packages("ggplot2", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org")
library(ggplot2)

# Create chart
ggplot(happiness2015, aes(Region, Happiness.Score)) + geom_boxplot() + ylim(0, 8) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1)) + ggtitle("Boxplots of 2015 world happiness scores") + ylab("Happiness score") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))



```
